study_metrics.description: Summary metrics per study showing total issues, average issues, max issues, and record counts for MedDRA and eSAE. This is a high-level overview table for comparing studies. Use for questions like 'which study has most issues', 'study-level statistics', 'comparing studies', 'how many studies'.

columns.study: Name of the clinical study (e.g., 'Study 1', 'Study 10'). Use this to filter by specific study.
columns.total_issues: Total number of unresolved data issues across all subjects in the study.
columns.avg_issues: Average number of issues per subject in the study.
columns.max_issues: Maximum number of issues for any single subject in the study.
columns.meddra_records: Total number of MedDRA coding records (adverse events, medical history) for the study.
columns.esae_records: Total number of eSAE (electronic Serious Adverse Event) records for the study.

edrr_processed.description: Compiled EDRR (External Data Reconciliation Report) - Summarizes total unresolved data issues for each subject for third-party data. Used for prioritizing data cleaning and issue resolution. Each row = one subject with open issues. Use for questions about 'issues per subject', 'data quality issues', 'subjects with problems'.

columns.subject: Unique identifier for each subject/patient (e.g., 'Subject 27371').
columns.total_open_issue_count_per_subject: Number of unresolved issues for this subject. Higher = more data quality issues.

esae_dashboard_processed.description: SAE Dashboard for Data Management - Tracks Serious Adverse Event discrepancies and review status from a data management perspective. Used for monitoring SAE data quality and review workflow. Each row = one SAE discrepancy. Use for questions about 'SAE', 'serious adverse events', 'discrepancies', 'review status', 'safety data'.

columns.discrepancy_id: Unique identifier for each discrepancy or issue.
columns.country: Country where the clinical site is located.
columns.site: Unique identifier for the clinical trial site.
columns.form_name: Name of the data entry form where the discrepancy was found.
columns.discrepancy_created_timestamp_in_dashboa: Date/time when the discrepancy was created.
columns.review_status: Current review status (e.g., 'Review Completed', 'Pending for Review').
columns.action_status: Status of actions taken (e.g., 'No action required', 'Pending').

esae_processed.description: SAE Dashboard for Safety Team - Tracks Serious Adverse Event discrepancies from safety perspective. Similar to esae_dashboard_processed but focused on safety team workflow. Each row = one SAE discrepancy. Use for safety-related SAE questions.

columns.country: Country where the site is located.
columns.site: Unique identifier for the clinical trial site.
columns.form_name: Name of the data entry form with the discrepancy.
columns.action_status: Status of actions taken or required.

meddra_processed.description: MedDRA Coding Report - Records all medical terms (adverse events, medical history) that require or have undergone MedDRA coding. Use for questions about 'coding status', 'uncoded terms', 'adverse events', 'medical history coding', 'MedDRA records'. Each row = one term requiring coding.

columns.meddra_coding_report: Indicates this is a MedDRA coding report.
columns.study: Name or ID of the clinical study.
columns.dictionary_version_number: Version of the MedDRA dictionary used.
columns.subject: Unique identifier for the subject/patient.
columns.form_oid: Object Identifier for the form in EDC system.
columns.logline: Line number or sequence for the coded entry.
columns.field_oid: Object Identifier for the specific field.
columns.coding_status: Status of coding (e.g., 'Coded Term', 'UnCoded Term'). Use to count coded vs uncoded.

whodd_processed.description: WHO Drug Coding Report - Records all medications and therapies that require or have undergone WHO Drug dictionary coding. Use for questions about 'drug coding', 'medication coding', 'WHO Drug', 'concomitant medications'. Each row = one medication entry.

columns.whodrug_coding_report: Indicates this is a WHO Drug coding report.
columns.study: Name or ID of the clinical study.
columns.dictionary_version_number: Version of the WHO Drug dictionary.
columns.subject: Unique identifier for the subject/patient.
columns.form_oid: Object Identifier for the form in EDC system.
columns.logline: Line number or sequence for the coded entry.
columns.field_oid: Object Identifier for the specific field.

missing_pages_processed.description: Global Missing Pages Report - Details missing CRF (Case Report Form) pages at individual visit level for each subject. Used to identify and follow-up on specific data gaps. Each row = one missing page. Use for questions about 'missing pages', 'missing CRF', 'data gaps', 'incomplete forms'.

columns.sitegroupname_countryname_: Country or region where the site is located.
columns.sitenumber: Unique identifier for the clinical trial site.
columns.visit_level_subject_status: Status of subject at the visit level.
columns.foldername: Name of the folder/module in EDC system.
columns.visit_date: Date of the scheduled or actual visit.
columns.form_type__summary_or_visit_: Indicates if missing page is from summary or specific visit.
columns.formname: Name of the form with missing pages.
columns.no___days_page_missing: Number of days the page has been missing. Higher = more urgent.

visit_projection_processed.description: Visit Projection Tracker - Lists all projected subject visits that haven't occurred or been entered, including days overdue. Used for tracking visit compliance and proactive follow-up. Each row = one missing/overdue visit. Use for questions about 'missing visits', 'overdue visits', 'visit compliance', 'projected visits'.

columns.country: Country where the clinical site is located.
columns.site: Unique identifier for the clinical trial site.
columns.subject: Unique identifier for the subject/patient.
columns.projected_date: Planned date for the visit as per protocol.
columns.__days_outstanding: Number of days since projected date. Positive = overdue.
columns.actual_date: Actual date the visit occurred (if any).
